data.title: StaticModel::AddComponent bug
Undefined Behavior in attributes
data.body:
URHO3D_ATTRIBUTE and URHO3D_ENUM_ATTRIBUTE use offsetof, but offsetof is allowed only for PODs (or standard layout types in C++11)
Actually, any class derived from Object is neither POD nor stdlayout. So, all serialization in Urho3D is based on UB.
http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/types/offsetof

Let's think about getting rid of it.

data.title: Minor Typo correction
data.body:
The current history (v1.6 right before release) has the below line

> AngelScript support on also on Emscripten and 64-bit iOS, based on generic bindings

corrected to 

> AngelScript support on Emscripten and 64-bit iOS, based on generic bindings

data.title: Triggers (buttons) in Component Editor
data.body:
It is useful sometimes to have some button in Component Editor that invokes some action in Component.
I have worked it around by creating fake bool attribute:

`#define URHO3D_TRIGGER_ATTRIBUTE(name, callback) URHO3D_ACCESSOR_ATTRIBUTE(name, GetFalse, callback, bool, false, AM_EDIT)`

However, it would be better to have some inbuilt solution for such cases. Real button in Component Editor should look much better than checkbox.

data.title: Input events
data.body:
Added three input-related events:
- E_INPUTBEGIN : input handling starts.
- E_INPUTEND : input handling ends.
- E_SDLRAWINPUT : raw SDL event is sent for customized event processing.

`E_SDLRAWINPUT` additionally checks `P_CONSUMED` value (which is `false` by default) and if it is set to true event is discarded. This is for libraries that would like to take over input handling completely.

Need for other two events arose from handling nuklear UI events. It requires to do some things before and after input handling. Without these events doing those tasks took bit of improper hackery abusing other events and their order which is not good at all.

data.title: Move the Forum to Discourse Free Hosting
data.body:
Hey guys,

Probably just throwing this out so you guys could consider it. It seems the current PhpBB forum is good but it's getting frequently less accessible these days so it might be a good idea to switch to a better platform.

Discourse is a great forum and it offers free/sponsorship forum to community friendly open source projects. There's a good chance that this project will be given free hosting/sponsorship even though it falls short of their 2k starred requirement. Urho3D already passed their 30 contributor requirement btw.

**Blog Announcement**
http://blog.discourse.org/2016/03/free-discourse-forum-hosting-for-community-friendly-github-projects/
**Application Form Link:**
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VqFmJmjqmOmZHkd3zVkQk906utqfVN8inq8pYZmS8dY/viewform

Just a suggestion.

Thanks!

data.title: Area Lighting
data.body:
Since my last commit on PBR i have put some work into area lighting. Although its far from PR ready, i thought id share some of the work with area lighting. I also plan to use this thread as a way to seek help on any issues i have.

Sphere Lights:
![screenshot_mon_aug__1_10_15_03_2016](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3044415/17289339/33108d50-57d1-11e6-9bbe-ff5820cb3533.png)

data.title: Made JSONValue.get_size() const
data.body: Really simple fix to allow scripts to use JSONValue.size property.

data.title: CMake fixes for compiling on Ubuntu 16.04
data.body:
- rapidjson and STB CMake `install_header_files` call using `USE_FILE_SYMLINK` causes "Too many levels of symbolic links" error.
- Ensure necessary folder required for tolua++ to build.
- Link `gcc_s` and `gcc` to work around GCC 5.4 issue with STB in shared libraries (known issue https://github.com/nothings/stb/issues/280).

This is as much a bug report as pull request - there may be better ways to solve these issues.  Especially the symbolic links issue - the fix doesn't address the underlying cause, just disables symlinks.

data.title: Alllow override of internal physics configuration and custom collision shapes
Add method to Texture2D for change glPixelStorei(GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH,stride);
Fixes to PBR demo and HDR option in editor so PBR displays correct
data.body:
Changes include the following:

Removed Bloom from PBR demo,
Set zone texture ambleint to 1,
Added HDR option in editor settings (needed for PBR in editor)

data.title: Add int64_t and uint64_t support for Serializer/Deserializer
data.body: Because int are not always sufficient, support 64b values to Serialisation interface

data.title: Add MSYS2 support for CMake
data.body: Not sure if you have tested this already but I think it would be nice to add MSYS2 build support.

data.title: cAmbientColor.a not taken in account on DX11
data.body: While testing new PBR implementation i found that changing zone ambient alpha color has not effect in IBL.hlsl shader (where cAmbientColor.a) is used so it seem that there is something wrong cAmbientColor uniform  on DX11.

data.title: Draw artifacts on MALI400 GPU
data.body:
Hi.
We have some troubles on devices with MALI400 graphics (Xamarin+urho).
This GPU have default dithering enabled in back buffers and resulted image of rendering is drawed with artifacts (tested on static scene from urho examples).

Please see details here http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2212.html and https://github.com/xamarin/urho/issues/137

Please add options to call glDisable(GL_DITHER) or may be help with other solution to remove artifacts.

data.title: String + int, String + uint, ... overloadings
data.body: "operator +=" defined, but "operator +" is missing

data.title: Add anchor and pivot to UIElement.
data.body:
I implemented new feature mentioned in #1366. New attribute mode AM_FILEREADONLY is used for keep compatibility with older layout files.

Please take a look at my changes. If it's not bad, I'll add script bindings as well.

data.title: Remove assert from ToVectorVariant
data.body:
ToVectorVariant cause assert when source string has unexpected number of elements.
I suppose that this function should have some other mechanism of error handling.

Firstly, other ToSomething functions work with any input data and just return when data is wrong.
**Secondly,** argument of ToVectorVariant may come directly from XML file, e.g. material.

I think that material with empty parameter value shouldn't cause assert and exit of Urho3D even in debug mode...

data.title: Text has no method SetFontSize
data.body: It has SetFont(Font\* font, int size); int GetFontFize(); but no method SetFontSize() to change the font size withouth changing the font.

data.title: Typo in OBJ exporter
data.body:
UV's are not exported properly

Branch: master
File: /Source/Urho3D/Graphics/Drawable.cpp
Line: 557

`unsigned texCoordOffset = (writeLightmapUV && hasLMUV) ? VertexBuffer::GetElementOffset(*elements, TYPE_VECTOR2, SEM_TEXCOORD, 1) : VertexBuffer::GetElementOffset(*elements, TYPE_VECTOR2, SEM_TEXCOORD, 9);`

Should be:

`unsigned texCoordOffset = (writeLightmapUV && hasLMUV) ? VertexBuffer::GetElementOffset(*elements, TYPE_VECTOR2, SEM_TEXCOORD, 1) : VertexBuffer::GetElementOffset(*elements, TYPE_VECTOR2, SEM_TEXCOORD, 0);`

data.title: Viewport getRect() returns 0, 0, 0, 0
data.body: And the GetView() View class has no means to get the `viewRect_` member so we can't get the viewport at all. Just takes the sample Hello World application to trigger this in `handleupdate`.
